parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240060), which is a strong indicator of electoral propaganda, as it's a unique identifier for candidates.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Florin Barbur, a candidate for the Chamber of Deputies for the REPER party.  This directly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, it's designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's clear objective is to encourage voters to support Florin Barbur and the REPER party in the parliamentary elections. The call to action "Votează Partidul reper" and the mention of the election date ("1 Decembrie") explicitly aim to influence the vote. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post presents information about educational policies, it's framed within a clear electoral context, promoting a specific candidate and party.  It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic content. It does not qualify as journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured campaign message promoting a candidate and party platform.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>456549750804666</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Florin Barbur), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is after the election, the post was active during the campaign), has a clear electoral objective (to garner votes for Barbur and REPER), and goes beyond simple journalistic reporting by explicitly advocating for a specific candidate and party. The presence of the CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's targeting, as shown in the `aaa_info` section, indicates a focused effort to reach potential voters in specific locations.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate>
    <name>FLORIN BARBUR</name>
    <impact>POSITIVE</impact>
  </candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>REPER</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Atelierul de internet SRL, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 456549750804666) cu caracter de propagandă electorală, care promovează candidatul Florin Barbur pentru Camera Deputaților din partea partidului REPER. Postarea, care a beneficiat de o investiție financiară între 100 și 199 RON,  conține un mesaj explicit de susținere a candidatului, inclusiv un apel direct la vot ("Votează Partidul reper") și menționarea datei alegerilor ("1 Decembrie"), având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea lui Florin Barbur și a partidului REPER.  Prezența codului CMF 11240060 confirmă natura electorală a postării.  Postarea a atins o audiență estimată între 15.000 și 20.000 de impresii, cu o estimare a potențialului de acoperire între 100.000 și 500.000 de persoane.  Datele de contact ale Atelierul de internet SRL sunt disponibile în Ad Library: andrei@atelieru.ro și +40755080070.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
